intro: Garuga abilo, commonly known as the African wild coffee, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many coffee and garden plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties and as a source of caffeine.
